text.p: Burlington Northern and Santa Fe Corp. said Thursday it has agreed to purchase 405 locomotives from General Motors Corp.'s Electro-Motive Division and GE Transportation Systems.
The company declined to disclose the cost of the deal.
The GM equipment will be delivered beginning with 26 this year, 105 in 1997 and 1998, and the rest in 1999 and 2000.
The Fort Worth, Texas-based railroad said by GE Transportation, a unit of General Electric Co., will deliver another 170 locomotives in 1997 and 1998.
Under the agreement with GM, a maintenance facility will be established at the Burlington Northern's new Los Angeles Mechanical Facility in City of Commerce, a Los Angeles suburb.
The facility is scheduled for completion during the first quarter of 1998. It will create about 80 new jobs, including 60 mechanics.
Burlington Northern operates one of the largest railroads in North America, with 35,000 route miles of track in 29 states and two Canadian provinces.
The company's stock rose 75 cents to $79.125 on the New York Stock Exchange.
